result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

and Disclosure filed by Atty Adam Welch

The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: __ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
- Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Willie T, Jemal M, or Zebidah Y.
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
Copy of minutes from BBH Hrg on 9/14/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Branch 7

1:56 PM Defendant Cristian E Concepcion in court, in custody.  Attorney Adam Matthias Welch in court for Cristian E Concepcion.  Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin. Madison Police Officer J. L., duly sworn and testified. Direct Exam by ADA Valerio. Venue established. Witness identification. Cross Exam by Atty Welch. Witness excused. State moves for bind over, waived argument, reserve rebuttal. Defn objected to bind over, waived argument. CT found PC this defn committed a felony and bound over to branch 7.

2:04 PM Defendant Cristian E Concepcion in court, in custody.  Attorney Adam Matthias Welch in court for Cristian E Concepcion.  Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defn requests signature bond, argument by Defn. State objects, argument by State. CT orders ($500) signature bond. CT refers Defn to DCPS. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME.
